H0.text: when did they start vaccinating for whooping cough. The 1920s

H1.text: when did they start vaccinating for whooping cough. The 1950s

H2.text: when did they start vaccinating for whooping cough. The 1930s

H3.text: when did they start vaccinating for whooping cough. the 1940s

A4.text: The pertussis vaccine was developed in 1926.

A5.text: The introduction of pertussis immunisation in the 1950s.

A6.text: In 1925 Danish physician Thorvald Madsen was the first to test a whole-cell vaccine on a wide scale.

A7.text: In 1942, American scientists Grace Eldering, Loney Gordon, and Pearl Kendrick combined the whole-cell pertussis vaccine with diphtheria and tetanus toxoids to generate the first DTP combination vaccine.
